email.title: Weekly Digest
email.text:
It's that time of the week again that I send an email.
We're gearing up for the candidate reveal and elections starting NOON, FRIDAY 2ND MARCH! Don't forget to vote at vote.union.ic.ac.uk from Friday onwards! There'll also be a 'Meet the Candidates' event, more on that below!
The other big thing happening this week is [Fiesta del Revel](https://revel.london). If you have a ticket that you wish to transfer to someone else, please email docsoc@ic.ac.uk for help.
Otherwise, see not so much below and have a nice week :).
email.heading: DoCSoc: Meet the Candidates
email.text:
We are currently planning to run a 'Meet the Candidates' event at the start of next week, where all of the candidates for DoCSoc (and DoC Departmental Representative) positions have a chance to deliver a short speech.
This is your chance to ask any questions you may have, and hear more about what each candidate is campaigning for!
The exact date, time, and location will be confirmed later this week, but this will probably happen around lunchtime in one of the lecture theatres.
Look out for further information on our [Facebook Page](https://www.facebook.com/pg/ICDocSoc/events/).
email.heading: Status of Hoodies, T-Shirts, and Beanies
email.text: Hoodies and T-shirts have finally been ordered and are on their way. They will be arriving later this week, so you should be informed about distribution shortly if you ordered a Hoodie, T-shirt, or Beanie.
email.heading: DoCSoc Hosts Google Hash Code

event.text:
**Registration deadline: 11.00 TOMORROW, 28th FEBRUARY!**
Hash Code is a team programming competition organised by Google for students and industry professionals across Europe, the Middle East and Africa. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a Google engineering problem for you to solve.
*Remember that you will have to to sign up on the Hash Code website to participate.*

email.heading: IC Health Hack 18

event.text:
**Registration will open in two batches: Thursday, March 1st at 20:00, Saturday, March 3rd at 12:00.**
The Department of Computing Society (DoCSoc), Bioengineering Society and ICSM Coding Society present the IC HealthHack 2018!
Combining bioengineering, coding skills and domain-specific medical knowledge, this Hackathon is aimed at developing serious games in the public health sector. Over the weekend, teams will compete to develop solutions to real-life healthcare challenges, before pitching to a panel of experts.

email.sign:
That's all for now!
Until next time,
email.text: This week's biscuit brought to you by: Nik. [Submit Biscuit](https://docsoc.co.uk/suggest-biscuit).
